intro: Hieracium oioense, commonly known as the Oio golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are basal and rough, with a yellowish-green color, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium oioense is an herbaceous perennial that produces seeds through wind dispersal.
